Modus poenitendi

Libellus de modo poenitendi et confitendi.

Paris: Jean Lambert, for Denis Roce, ca. 1500
8vo. [Bii- Di]. [39]leaves of which 32v-39v are blank.
ISTC im00777000 Goff M777; Lenz 334; GW M13822

 

Shelf-mark:   Summerfield A87
Provenance:   From the library of Anselmi Van den Bogaerde, an aristocrat and bibliophile living in 19th-century Bruges.
Binding:   19th century, possibly French. Brown calf with blind stamped decoration at edges and center covers.
Annotations:   Underlining and marginalia in 16th century hand throughout. Manicula at 6v. Heavy annotations and vigoruous underlining at 31v-32, the “duodecim sunt articuli fidei,” where each article of faith is underlined and enumerated in the margins for additional emphasis.
Decoration:   Printers woodcut of Médée (Medea) and a knight labeled “Paravis: 88 / Denis : Rosse :” found at 3r.
Imperfections:   None identified
